text: Michal Golus (born 10 January 1996) is a swimmer from Poland who competes in Paralympic S8 and SM8 (individual medley) events. Michal Golus - Paralympic Bio At the 2018 World Para Swimming European Championships in Dublin he won the 50 and 100 metre freestyle titles in the S8 category.Dublin 2018 - 50 metre freestyle S8Dublin 2018 - 100 metre freestyle S8 ==Career history== Golus began swimming in 2012, and first raced international at the 2017 World Para Swimming Championships. Golus came to international attention winning two titles at the 2018 European championships, along with the silver medal in the 100 metre butterfly at the same meet. ==Personal life== Golus is a graduate in Computer Science from the University of Technology and Humanities in Radom, Poland. ==References== Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Polish male swimmers Category:Paralympic swimmers of Poland Category:S8-classified Paralympic swimmers Category:Medalists at the World Para Swimming European Championships Category:People from Radom
title: Michal Golus
